title: LP Points (Rank Game)
body: If I win a rank game i get less LP points and when I lose, I loss more LP points. its not fair. Please explain why is this?

replies.body:
Everyone's touched on the MMR system on a basic level and it sounds like you're starting to get the concept, so I'll just look to add a little bit extra to help you .

So your MMR will move up or down on every win or loss regardless of your LP gains, this means that situations where your LP does not change (or hits a barrier on a lesser amount) will still contribute towards your MMR changes. 

For example:
* Winning/Losing in Promotion Series
* Winning on 99lp (Gain 1 LP, but full amount of MMR will be gained for the win)
* Losing on 0LP (or close to it in a similar fashion as above)

A situation where you go on a win-streak and win on 99lp then go 2-0 in promotions will skyrocket your MMR relative to your current League and LP stance. This is always occurring and balancing itself. If this MMR is above or below your current rank then your LP gains will change relative to the difference. There is no way to find your exact MMR, but understanding the concept should help you to grasp exactly why the system is acting the way it does. 

Essentially MMR always changes, LP doesn't. If your MMR exceeds the average for your rank then you'll see higher LP gains and lower losses and vice versa when your MMR is lower.

So MMR is match making ranking in which they determine game so both teams have a near equal MMR. The problem is yours is much lower then Silver 1 as shown by the last game you played which was Silver4 S4 S4 S5 S1 on your team. and S2 S2 S3 S3 and B1 on the other team. So you are probably trying to get you back to silver 3/4ish which is about the standard which you are currently playing with. Hope that helps

LP gains and losses are based on your mmr. If your mmr is deemed to be lower than the division you're in you will lose more than you gain because it's trying to get you where it believes you belong

You have a good win rate at 55% this season, do you duo a lot of games or party up because I think that can have an effect on LP gains losses too.

Short answer - MMR is your current skill level. Just like chess, if you are playing against players of lower MMR, then you are expected to beat them, so your MMR gains are lower. Conversely, if you beat players of higher MMR, your MMR will rise at a higher rate. 

LP gains/losses is based on your MMR compared to the average MMR at your rank.
